tit.cmt: タイトルのためカッコ内の補足削除 (次文に説明あり)

sen.j: ヒジキ（鹿尾菜、羊栖菜、学名：Sargassum fusiforme、シノニム：Hizikia fusiformis）は、褐藻類ホンダワラ科ホンダワラ属の海藻の一種である。
sen.e: Hijiki (scientific name: Sargassum fusiforme, synonym: Hizikia fusiformis) is a kind of seaweed of Class Phaeophyceae Family Sargassaceae Genus Sargassum.
sen.cmt: シノニム→synonymと訳しております。
sen.e: Hijiki (scientific name: Sargassum fusiforme, synonym: Hizikia fusiformis) is a kind of seaweed of the Class Phaeophyceae Family Sargassaceae Genus Sargassum.
Hijiki (scientific name: Sargassum fusiforme, synonym: Hizikia fusiformis) is a kind of seaweed of the Class Phaeophyceae Family Sargassaceae Genus Sargassum.

sen.j: 波の荒い海岸近くの岩場の潮間帯付近に繁茂し、春から初夏に胞子嚢を付けて成熟する。
sen.e: Hijiki grows near intertidal zones in rocky areas close to the choppy seashore.
Hijiki grows near intertidal zones in rocky areas close to the choppy seashore.
Hijiki grows near intertidal zones in rocky areas close to the choppy seashore.

sen.j: 「ひじきを食べると長生きする」と古くから言われており敬老の日に因んで9月15日は「ひじきの日」となっている。
sen.e: It has been said traditionally that "a person who eats hijiki lives longer," and in connection with Respect-for-Senior-Citizens Day, September 15 is designated as Hijiki no Hi (Hijiki Day).
sen.cmt: ひじきの日：定訳不明です。
sen.e: It has been said traditionally that "a person who eats hijiki lives longer," and in connection with Respect-for-Senior-Citizens Day, September 15 is designated as Hijiki no Hi (Hijiki Day).
It has been said traditionally that 'a person who eats hijiki lives longer,' and in connection with Respect-for-Senior-Citizens Day, September 15 is designated as Hijiki no Hi (Hijiki Day).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 分布
sen.e: Distribution
Distribution
Distribution

sen.j: 日本では北海道から本州、四国、九州、南西諸島（奄美大島、沖縄島）に、日本国外では朝鮮半島及び中国南部に分布する。
sen.e: Areas in Japan where Hijiki is distributed are Honshu (the main island of Japan), the Shikoku region, the Kyushu region, and the Nansei Islands (the Amami-Oshima Island, the islands of Okinawa), and areas outside Japan are the Korean Peninsula and southern China.
sen.cmt: 奄美大島：用語集にはAmami-Oshima Island と Amami-oshima island とが登録されていましたが、登録日付の新しい前者を用いております。
sen.e: Areas in Japan where Hijiki is distributed are Honshu (the main island of Japan), the Shikoku region, the Kyushu region, and the Nansei Islands (the Amami-Oshima Island, the islands of Okinawa), and areas outside Japan are the Korean Peninsula and southern China.

Areas in Japan where Hijiki is distributed are Honshu (the main island of Japan), the Shikoku region, the Kyushu region, and the Nansei Islands (the Amami-Oshima Island, the islands of Okinawa), and areas outside Japan are the Korean Peninsula and southern China.

sen.j: 生育環境
sen.e: Growing Environment
Growing Environment
Growing Environment

sen.j: 潮間帯下部から低潮線の岩上に帯状分布する。
sen.e: Hijiki is distributed in zones from lower areas of intertidal zones onto rocks on low-tide lines.
Hijiki is distributed in zones from lower areas of intertidal zones onto rocks on low-tide lines.
Hijiki is distributed in zones from lower areas of intertidal zones onto rocks on low-tide lines.

sen.j: 分類
sen.e: Classification
Classification
Classification

sen.j: ヒジキは、ヒジキ属Hizikiaに含められていたが、吉田（2001）による分子系統学的研究からホンダワラ属（Sargassum）に含められた。
sen.e: Hijiki used to be included in Genus Hizikia, but is currently included in Genus Sargassum as a result of the Molecular Phylogeny conducted by Yoshida (2001).
Hijiki used to be included in the Genus Hizikia, but is currently included in Genus Sargassum as a result of the Molecular Phylogeny conducted by Yoshida (2001).
Hijiki used to be included in the Genus Hizikia, but is currently included in Genus Sargassum as a result of the Molecular Phylogeny conducted by Yoshida (2001).

sen.j: 形態
sen.e: Morphology
Morphology
Morphology

sen.j: 長さは50-100cm。
sen.e: Hijiki has a length of 50-100 cm.
Hijiki has a length of 50-100 cm.
Hijiki has a length of 50-100 cm.

sen.j: 根は匍匐し岩上に付着する。
sen.e: Stolons creep and adhere onto rocks.
Stolons creep and adhere onto rocks.
Stolons creep and adhere onto rocks.

sen.j: 根から1-数本の主枝（茎）を伸ばし、主枝から葉と小枝を出す。
sen.e: One to several main branches (stems) extend from stolons, and twigs and leaves sprout from main branches.
One to several main branches (stems) extend from stolons, and twigs and leaves sprout from main branches.
One to several main branches (stems) extend from stolons, and twigs and leaves sprout from main branches.

sen.j: 主枝は円柱状で太さ3-4mm。
sen.e: Main branches are cylindrical and have a thickness of 3-4 mm.
Main branches are cylindrical and have a thickness of 3-4 mm.
Main branches are cylindrical and have a thickness of 3-4 mm.

sen.j: 葉はへら形で葉縁に鋸歯を持つ。
sen.e: Leaves are in the shape of a spatula, and have saw-tooth edges.
Leaves are in the shape of a spatula, and have saw-tooth edges.
Leaves are in the shape of a spatula, and have saw-tooth edges.

sen.j: ヒジキは主に食材として利用される。
sen.e: Hijiki is mainly used as a foodstuff.
Hijiki is mainly used as a foodstuff.
Hijiki is mainly used as a foodstuff.

sen.j: 干ひじき（ほしひじき）として販売されることが多い。
sen.e: Mostly sold as hoshi hijiki (dried seaweed).
Mostly sold as hoshi hijiki (dried seaweed).
Mostly sold as hoshi hijiki (dried seaweed).

sen.j: 加工の方法は、主に伊勢方式と呼ばれる乾燥原藻を水戻しして蒸乾する蒸乾法と、煮乾法に大別される。
sen.e: Processing methods are roughly divided into steam and dry methods called Ise hoshiki (a traditional steaming method) in which dried algae is rehydrated and then steamed and dried, and boiling and drying methods.
sen.cmt: 蒸乾法、煮乾法：定訳不明です。
sen.e: Processing methods are roughly divided into steam and dry methods called Ise hoshiki (a traditional steaming method) in which dried algae is rehydrated and then steamed and dried, and boiling and drying methods.

Processing methods are roughly divided into steam and dry methods called Ise hoshiki (a traditional steaming method) in which dried algae is rehydrated and then steamed and dried, and boiling and drying methods.

sen.j: 煮乾法ではさらに、房州製法に代表される生原藻を煮乾する方法と、乾燥原藻を水戻しして煮乾する製法とに分かれる。
sen.e: The boiling and drying methods are further divided into methods exemplified by bosyu seiho (method of boiling and drying raw algae) in which raw algae is boiled and dried, and methods in which dried algae is rehydrated and then boiled and dried.
sen.cmt: 煮乾法、房州製法、生原藻、乾燥原藻：定訳不明です。また、房州製法について、用語集に従い bosyu seiho と記載致しました。
sen.e: The boiling and drying methods are further divided into methods exemplified by bosyu seiho (method of boiling and drying raw algae) in which raw algae is boiled and dried, and methods in which dried algae is rehydrated and then boiled and dried.

The boiling and drying methods are further divided into methods exemplified by Boshu seiho (method of boiling and drying raw algae) in which raw algae is boiled and dried, and methods in which dried algae is rehydrated and then boiled and dried.

sen.j: 生きている間は茶色～褐色だが、加工するにつれ真黒になる。
sen.e: The color is brown to brownish while it is alive, but turns black as it is processed.
Its color is brown to brownish while it is alive, but turns black as it is processed.
Its color is brown to brownish while it is alive, but turns black as it is processed.

sen.j: 干ひじきは、水で戻してから醤油、砂糖などで煮て食べる「ひじきの五目煮」がポピュラーである。
sen.e: "Hijiki no Gomoku ni (stewed hijiki mixture)" prepared by dehydrating hoshi hijiki and then boiled with soy sauce, sugar, and the like is a popular way of eating hoshi hijiki.
sen.cmt: ひじきの五目煮：定訳不明です。
sen.e: "Hijiki no Gomoku ni (stewed hijiki mixture)" prepared by dehydrating hoshi hijiki and then boiled with soy sauce, sugar, and the like is a popular way of eating hoshi hijiki.
Hijiki no Gomoku ni' (stewed hijiki mixture) prepared by dehydrating hoshi hijiki and then boiled with soy sauce, sugar, and the like is a popular way of eating hoshi hijiki.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、カッコ文の位置を移動

sen.j: 近年はひじきご飯に加え、サラダ、酢の物、天ぷらなど幅広い料理に利用されている。
sen.e: In recent years, it is used in wide varieties of foods such as salad, vinegared food, and Tempura, in addition to Hijiki Gohan (boiled rice with hijiki, vegetables and meat or mixed rice and stewed hijiki mixture).
sen.cmt: ひじきご飯：定訳不明です。
sen.e: In recent years, it is used in wide varieties of foods such as salad, vinegared food, and Tempura, in addition to Hijiki Gohan (boiled rice with hijiki, vegetables and meat or mixed rice and stewed hijiki mixture).

In recent years, it is used in wide varieties of foods such as salad, vinegared food, and Tempura, in addition to Hijiki Gohan (boiled rice with hijiki, vegetables and meat or mixed rice and stewed hijiki mixture).

sen.j: ひじきは通常3月から5月の大潮の干潮時に漁師や海女が磯にでて鎌などで刈り取って収穫する。
sen.e: Hijiki is generally collected with a sickle in rocky shores by fishermen and woman shell divers during low tide in spring tide from March to May.
Hijiki is generally collected with a sickle in rocky shores by fishermen and woman shell divers during low tide in the spring tide from March to May.
Hijiki is generally collected with a sickle in rocky shores by fishermen and woman shell divers during low tide in the spring tide from March to May.

sen.j: 地域によっては、寒中（11月から2月）に幼芽を収穫したひじきもある。
sen.e: In some areas, budlets of hijiki are collected during the mid-winter (November to February).
In some areas, budlets of hijiki are collected during the mid-winter (November to February).
In some areas, budlets of hijiki are collected during the mid-winter (November to February).

sen.j: ひじきは細長い茎の部分と葉や芽のように出ている部分を分離して製品化されることが多い。
sen.e: Thin and long stem parts of hijiki and extruding parts such as leaves and buds are separately processed into products.
Thin and long stem parts of hijiki and extruding parts such as leaves and buds are separately processed into products.
Thin and long stem parts of hijiki and extruding parts such as leaves and buds are separately processed into products.

sen.j: 茎の部分だけにしたものを長ひじき、茎ひじき、糸ひじきなどという。
sen.e: Products of separated stem parts are called naga hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), kuki hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), ito hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), and the like.

Products of separated stem parts are called naga hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), kuki hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), ito hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), and the like.

Products of separated stem parts are called naga hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), kuki hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), ito hijiki (long hijiki, the stem of the plant), and the like.

sen.j: 芽の部分だけにしたものを 芽ひじき、姫ひじき、米ひじきなどという。
sen.e: Products of separated bud parts are called me hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), hime hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), kome hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), and the like.

Products of separated bud parts are called me hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), hime hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), kome hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), and the like.

Products of separated bud parts are called me hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), hime hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), kome hijiki (bud of hijiki, the leaf of the plant), and the like.

sen.j: 長ひじきと芽ひじきは料理方法や好みで使い分ければ良い。
sen.e: Naga hijiki and me hijiki may be chosen according to a way of cooling or a preference.
Naga hijiki and me hijiki may be chosen according to its method of cooling or preference.
Naga hijiki and me hijiki may be chosen according to its method of cooking or preference.

tit.j: 無機ヒ素の含有率をめぐる動き
tit.e: Movements Related to Inorganic Arsenic Content Percentage
Movements Related to Inorganic Arsenic Content Percentage
Movements Related to Inorganic Arsenic Content Percentage

sen.j: 2001年10月、カナダ食品検査庁は、発癌性のある無機ヒ素の含有率が、ヒジキにおいて他の海藻類よりも非常に高いという報告を発表し、消費をひかえるよう勧告した。
sen.e: In October 2001, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency reported that hijiki contains a higher percentage of carcinogenic inorganic arsenic than those in other seaweeds, and recommended avoiding hijiki.
In October 2001, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency reported that hijiki contains a higher percentage of carcinogenic inorganic arsenic than those in other seaweeds, and recommended avoiding hijiki.
In October 2001, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency reported that hijiki contains a higher percentage of carcinogenic inorganic arsenic than those in other seaweeds, and recommended avoiding hijiki.

sen.j: これは複数の調査によって裏付けられ、イギリス・香港・ニュージーランドなどの食品安全関係当局も同様の勧告を発表した。
sen.e: This is supported by multiple surveys, and food safety authorities of the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, and New Zealand announced the same recommendation.
sen.cmt: 食品安全関係当局：用語集には Food Safety Authority と記載されていますが、ここでは小文字を用いております。
sen.e: This is supported by multiple surveys, and food safety authorities of the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, and New Zealand announced the same recommendation.
This is supported by multiple surveys, and food safety authorities of the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, and New Zealand announced the same recommendation.

sen.j: 一方、日本の厚生労働省は、2004年7月、調査結果のヒ素含有量からすると、継続的に毎週33g以上（水戻しした状態のヒジキ。体重50kgの成人の場合）を摂取しない限り世界保健機関（WHO）の暫定的耐容週間摂取量を上回ることはなく、現在の日本人の平均的摂取量に照らすと、通常の食べ方では健康リスクが高まることはない、との見解を示した。
sen.e: The Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan, on the other hand, announced their opinion in July 2004 that in view of the arsenic contents in the results of the surveys, the provisional tolerable weekly intake announced by the World Health Organization (WHO) would not be exceeded unless 33 g or more (of dehydrated hijiki, in cases of a 50-kg adult) was regularly taken into per week, and that in view of the current average intake of Japanese people, the health risk was not likely to rise in cases of normal consumption.

The Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan, on the other hand, announced their opinion in July 2004 that in view of the arsenic contents in the results of the surveys, the provisional tolerable weekly intake announced by the World Health Organization (WHO) would not be exceeded unless 33 g or more (of dehydrated hijiki, in cases of a 50-kg adult) was regularly taken into per week, and that in view of the current average intake of Japanese people, the health risk was not likely to rise in cases of normal consumption.

The Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan, on the other hand, announced their opinion in July 2004 that in view of the arsenic contents in the results of the surveys, the provisional tolerable weekly intake announced by the World Health Organization (WHO) would not be exceeded unless 33 g or more (of dehydrated hijiki, in cases of a 50-kg adult) was regularly taken into per week, and that in view of the current average intake of Japanese people, the health risk was not likely to rise in cases of normal consumption.

sen.j: また、海藻中のヒ素による健康被害があったとの報告はないとした。
sen.e: They also announced that no health damage caused by arsenic contained in seaweed was reported.
They also announced that no health damage caused by arsenic contained in seaweed was reported.
They also announced that no health damage caused by arsenic contained in seaweed was reported.

sen.e: The Okinawa Prefecture version of Red Data Book
The Okinawa Prefecture version of the Red Data Book
